captions.text:
Hey guys! I'm super excited about today's
nail art design because it's inspired by the

new Pokemon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire
games for 3DS. I've been a big fan of Pokemon

since I was a kid, haha, that's me outside
with a marill I made out of snow, food colouring,

and a metal coat hanger. I've played allllll
the generations of pokemon games because I

think they're really fun and great way to
relax.

So I'm really happy to have partnered with
Nintendo today to bring you a bright and colorful

Pokemon nail art design. It features the three
partner Pokemon from Omega Ruby and Alpha
Sapphire.
So let's get started!

The first design, which I have on my pinky
and thumb, is a poke ball. Begin by painting

your nail red. Next use a white polish and
paint the bottom half of your nail with it.

Then use a big dotting tool to press a dot
in the middle of the nail. Then use a black

striper and cover the area where the red meets
the white with a solid black line on each

side. Finish the poke ball with a small white
dot in the centre of the black one.

Next up is Treecko. Begin by painting your
nail green. Then use a white polish and a

toothpick to create a white base for its eye.
This will allow the colors placed over it

to really pop. Allow the white to completely
dry and then fill it in using a yellow polish.

When using a toothpick for nail art, I like
to use a stippling motion for best results.

Once that's done, use a black striper and
draw a long black line over the top of the

eye, and then outline the rest of the eye.
Then draw a black line down the middle of

the eye, and a thin curved line near the cuticle.
Finish the design with some white on the eye.

Up next is Torchic. Begin by painting your
nail orange. Then use a big dotting tool to

create two large dots for eyes. For its beak,
create a white base again using a toothpick.

I'm just doing a diamond shape here and then
extending the sides out a little. When you're

finished, give it a few minutes to dry. Then
add in some pink to the middle of the white

and then fill in the rest of it with yellow.
While you wait for that to dry, you can dot

the eyes with white polish. Finally, use a
black striper to outline the beak. Take your

time while you do this and have both hands
rested on the table.

Finally we have Mudkip. Begin by painting
your nail blue. Next you will want a big half

circle on the side of your nail. You can create
this with a striper, or go ahead and use a

toothpick again. After that's done, you will
need another half circle at the tip of the

nail. I just used a regular nail polish brush
for this. Once those bases are dried, go ahead

and fill in the first half circle using a
golden yellow polish. Then fill in the other

half circle using a light blue. While you
wait for that to dry, use a big dotting tool

to create an eye. Then using a toothpick dot
two little nostrils. And then use a black

striper to outline both of the half circles.
Finally, dot the eye with white and add three
diagonal lines near the cuticle with a striper.

There's a lot of black polish and detailing
in this manicure, so give it at least 15 minutes

to dry before applying a fast drying top coat.
Also make sure to use a generous amount to

prevent smearing and glide it across the nail
without the brush actually touching the nail
because that can drag the design with it.

And that's it! If you decide to give this
design a try, please share your recreations

with me on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram
using the hashtag #cutepolish!
Take care, and I'll seeya next time!

title: Pokemon Omega Ruby & Alpha Sapphire Nails!
